abstract: The opposition by Institutional Shareholder Services is another big blow to the proposed all-stock merger of Transatlantic Holdings with Allied World Assurance.
snippet: The opposition by Institutional Shareholder Services is another big blow to the proposed all-stock merger of Transatlantic Holdings with Allied World Assurance.
lead_paragraph: The proposed merger of Transatlantic Holdings with Allied World Assurance experienced a fresh setback on Friday, as a major shareholder advisory firm recommended that investors vote against the $2.86 billion deal.

headline.main: I.S.S. Comes Out Against Transatlantic’s Deal With Allied

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
